Important Things and Specification

Depending on your circumstances and what is important to you, a lease could be a great option for your next vehicle. Below are some important factors that may influence your decision.

  • Health

    Each state in the U.S. has different guidelines in regards to guaranteed health for sold puppies. For states that do not have a mandatory health guarantee in place, any breeder advertising through our site is expected to cover the health of their puppies for at least 30 days. In the event that a state guideline is in place offering a guarantee longer than 30 days, that law holds precedence.

  • Physical Exercise

    Your Golden Retriever will need a minimum of two hours of good exercise per day. It's best to spread this out across the day and include walks and lots of running, with extra playtime and training on top. You can find out how much exercise your dog needs, or even find exercises you can do together. Adult Golden Retrievers require a reasonable amount of exercise to keep them in top shape. Don't overexert puppies, otherwise bone or joint problems may occur. A couple of hours of exercise a day is enough for an adult dog, though he'll enjoy more if you can provide it!

  • Nutrition

    Golden Retrievers can consume a wide variety of healthy and nutritious foods. Proteins – beef, chicken, lamb, pork, and salmon; grains – wheat, oats, corn, and rice; dairy such as plain yogurt and cheese; vegetables; peas, pumpkin, carrots; fruits such as apples and berries are just a few examples. Large breeds of dogs with large appetites require a different mix of nutrients, including minerals and vitamins, compared to smaller dogs. Golden Retrievers are prone to flatulence and stomach problems. To reduce the risk of these problems, a more frequent and divided diet is recommended.

  • Hair Care

    Golden Retrievers shed all year long, but typically shed more in the spring and fall when their coats change. Ideally, your Golden Retriever should be brushed daily to improve shedding. Regular use of an undercoat rake can also be a big help for you (and your couch). The Golden Retriever's thick coat requires regular care. The undercoat has a water repellent function and is therefore very thick. But it must not be allowed to fall off: tangles cause discomfort to the animal. Although the long coat quickly collects water and dirt, when it dries, it is quite easy to clean.
